titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to restore age 14 as the age at which unearned income of minor children ceases to be taxed as if parent's income.
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to restore age 14 as the age at which unearned income of minor children ceases to be taxed as if parent's income.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: Repeals the provision in the Tax Increase Prevention and Reconciliation Act of 2005 which increased from 14 to 18 the age until which the unearned income of children is taxed at their parents' marginal income tax rates (thus restoring the age limit to 14).
